page.title: 04LOCAL NEWS - MAY 1985
page.content: {SPORT {HILL WALKING & PARACHUTING - }Sporting enthusiasts willing to participate in parachuting and hill walking are required in order to raise money for charity.Several successful jumps have recently been made to aid MIND - the national charity for mental welfare. It is very likely that a parachute club will be started in Dunbar. With regard to hill walking, interested parties are being sought to join a local team entering the annual Ben Lomond Sponsored Climb.The 3192 ft. climb will be attempted on 26/5/85 to raise funds for the Royal Commonwealth Society for the Blind. Gillian Laird (22) has been picked for the first GB Students Volleyball team to take part in the World Student Games in Japan and the Commonwealth Championships in Australia this year.
